result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Rehlinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any imposed prison sentence and to any sentence currently being served

miscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with any of the victims or with any Culver's or BP gas stations located in Washington County, WI.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall pay Department of Corrections supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def in person & by Atty Wilfred P. De Junco.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  PSI author appearing by phone.  Statements from victim and victim's wife in 15CF74, statements from def's father.  PSI has been reviewed; corrections/clarifications noted on the record.  PSI author excused from remainder of hearing.  Argument from State and counsel.  Atty Dejunco moves to have def's sentencing memo sealed. Statement from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

(copy) Dodge Correctional Institution; 9/1/15
Disposition Form
Sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 10:30 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Wilfred P. De Junco.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Wife of victim in Ct 2 of 15CF74 also present.  CASES CALLED:  15CF74 & 15CF80.  Agreement reached with PSI recommended on Ct 2 & 4 in 15CF74 and in 15CF80 - State agrees to cap recommendation at 22 yrs initial confinement, no cap on E/S; def will be free to argue.  Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def and accepts waiver.  State files and Court reviews Information w/def.  Def enters no contest plea.  Court finds def guilty and orders presentence investigation report be prepared.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Def via video & by Atty Wilfred P. De Junco in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Pretrial held - resolution expected; def to appear via video unless case will resolve. Bond faxed to def at DCI; to be returned obtaining signature being obtained
Hearing at 05-27-2015 09:45 am

Def appears in custody via video & w/Atty Wilfred P. de Junco in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.   Court questions state re length of delay in charging.  Def currently incarcerated on unrelated case - expects to be released Sept, 2015.  Def also has pending case in Wauk Co.  Court sets $75,000 cash bond.  Def waives time limits re preliminary hearing; Court accepts waiver.  Counsel req adj - resolution expected.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing; def to appear via video unless counsel advises otherwise.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:45 am.
